name: Chaga
description: The Chaga (Inonotus obliquus) is an important medicinal mushroom that is traditionally used especially in Russia and Northern Europe. The fungus forms black, coal-like growths (sclerotia) on living birch trees. Its antioxidant, immunostimulating and antitumoral properties have been valued for centuries. It is considered one of the strongest antioxidants among mushrooms.
